<p>In this session, we will discuss the differences between code commenting and documenting and exchange tips on best practices!</p><p><strong>Possible resources to prepare your session’s hack:</strong></p><ul>
<li>
<a href="https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/managing-your-repositorys-settings-and-features/customizing-your-repository/about-readmes">How to write good READMEs for your code repositories</a> to tell others why your project is useful and what they can do with it</li>
<li>
<a href="https://docs.github.com/en/communities/documenting-your-project-with-wikis/about-wikis">How to write good WIKIs for your projects</a> so that others can use and contribute to your project.</li>
<li><a href="https://realpython.com/documenting-python-code/" target="_blank">Python Documentation techniques</a></li>
</ul>
<div></div><p><strong>Sessions’ agenda:</strong></p><ul>
<li>Brief round of introductions and description of the problems you’ll be working on during that session</li>
<li>Formation of possible groups or tandems, if participants have tips to exchange on certain topics</li>
<li>Hack</li>
<li>Wrap-up: progress and next steps</li>
</ul>
<p>Learn more about the Hacky Hour initiative <a href="../../meetups/hackyhour/index.html" title="Hacky Hour">here</a>.</p><div class="g-clear"></div>
